page.title: 19ORCHARD HOUSE
page.content: { Orchard House,}standing in 2 acres of ground, is a home for th old and disabled, financed by the county council. Mrs. Duppar has been the matron since it opened in 1975.The staff include 4 full time, and 1 part time employees. There are 32 residents, of which 4 are short stay and one is physically handicapped. They are encouraged to be independant, having their own rooms, where they keep pictures, furniture, pets etc.. Privacy is respected, but they eat in a common room. Twelve bungalows are connected through a bell system to the home. They provide a day care centre. Money is at present bieng raised for a holiday next year.
